channel.title: 'Javac' is not recognized as an internal or external command...Help!
channel.description:
C:\Users\Steven\Desktop\20051104-server>javac *.java 'javac' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.
Press any key to continue . . .
This is all i get when i try to compile or run. I can't get my environmental variables set correctly, can someone tell me how to please? Like fresh, starting with the CLASSPATH and PATH, tell me what to do to get it to work step by step. Thanks!

item.title: 'Javac' is not recognized as an internal or external command...Help!
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files (86x)\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
C:\Program Files (86x)\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin;

Read full topic
item.source: 'Javac' is not recognized as an internal or external command...Help!

item.title: 'Javac' is not recognized as an internal or external command...Help!
item.dc:creator: @aquatizscape aquatizscape
item.description:
@aquatizscape wrote:

ok i just found java in my program files. Instead of in program files, it’s in program files (x86). Can you edit my codes from my PATH and CLASSPATH for me?

I dont know what to put in classpath or path. I have jdk 6u16. can you make the codes please?

Read full topic
item.source: 'Javac' is not recognized as an internal or external command...Help!

item.title: 'Javac' is not recognized as an internal or external command...Help!
item.dc:creator: @Fluffee Fluffee
item.description:
@Fluffee wrote:

I believe it is C:\Program Files\Javaversion\Bin\java.Exe

The version part is the version of the Java that you downloaded.

Fluffee

Read full topic

item.title: 'Javac' is not recognized as an internal or external command...Help!
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“Fluffee, post:2, topic:312174”]You need to set the paths to where Java is installed to on your computer.

Fluffee[/quote]

Aka environment Variables

Read full topic
